newsitem.title: USA: AOL talks to buy CompuServe for $1.2 bln-WSJ.
newsitem.headline: AOL talks to buy CompuServe for $1.2 bln-WSJ.

text.p: America Online is in talks to buy rival CompuServe Corp for around $1.2 billion, the Wall Street Journal said in Monday's electronic edition.

Negotiators spent the weekend working on terms, under which AOL would acquire CompuServe for a price in the range of $11 to $14 a share or about $1.2 billion in America Online stock, the newspaper said.
At a $14 per share bid, AOL would have to issue about 26 million new shares to buy CompuServe from H&R Block Inc, which owns 80 percent of the company, it said.
Executives familiar with the talks said the companies hope to make a deal as early as this week, the Journal said
But the exact price might prove difficult to negotiate, the newspaper said.
